name: places/ChIJqd2yaHVZwokR6KBuYxaS6d8
formattedAddress: 350 E 17th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
adrFormatAddress: 350 E 17th St, New York, NY 10003-3805, USA

originalText.text: "I waited 7 months to be seen by Dr. Gilyadov. The day of my appointment I arrived at 7:45am, 15 minutes early. The staff in the office was very professional. I was told the doctor was running an hour behind. I was taken to the room and after about 30 more minutes was told he would be two hours late. Patients can get charged for not showing up, patients can be made to reschedule if they are not on time, but what happens when the doctor is 2 hours late for his first appointment of the morning? Not even a phone call from Dr. Gilyadov to make an apology to me and attempt to have me reschedule. What about my time and the money it cost me to get to my appointment? I don't care how far the doctor was traveling from, get up earlier to avoid traffic. If I were the doctor, I would have personally made a phone call to my patient in order to attempt to make things right. I waited 7 months to be treated poorly. I will let the doctor that referred me to Dr. Gilyadov know he should not refer others."
